comment: "Said $150 would rise next time I pitched, which it did to $250. Very minimal edits. Was published without seeing a final draft."

"Editor offered $200 less for this piece than for articles the same length that I've written for them in the past, saying their budget was strapped. Agreed because I like the publication & wanted to write the story. Will not write for them again at this price, though. The piece required 9 sources and even though it was tied to a dated, news event, the editor waited 3 weeks to send me his edits. The edits took 4 hours to get through and were mainly defending the meticulous fact check I performed before writing against incorrect information the editor found in a Google search online. Then the editor killed the piece (rate provided Who Pays Writers? reflects this kill fee--had it published, payment would have been $300). He was polite in doing so, but I wish he hadn't said "maybe you can place it elsewhere." You can't place a breaking news story "elsewhere" 3 weeks after the event it's about it over."
